Content:
at the end of the article, they wrote 
```Rizun’s paper notes that the issue adds unneeded friction from layer one to layer two by “forcing complex and poorly-understood work-arounds to the L2 protocol.”```
I cannot agree more with the end of the sentence : few solutions that were explained (on LN chats/forums) were not realistic. Poorly understood work around is also a risk that these work arounds are performed by paid services (exchanges ?) because too complex for users

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yes, that was SHAttered: http://shattered.it/

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Quite the big deal when it came out. That is the main reason why Git is migrating to SHA256

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Git is not vulnerable to the exact SHAttered attack, but it sure does not make them sleep well at night

Author: m_maria_a#0348
Content: question about sha family: why those logical functions where chosen for hashing and not any others? I mean why for example  there is f(i, B, C, D) = (B and C) or ((not B) and D) used for 0>= i >=19 in sha1 and not any other values of i or any other function? Or why there is shift 5 to the right in the sha2? or even how do i choose first 5 H for sha1 algorithm?

Author: m_maria_a#0348
Content: i cannot find any detailed explanation in the internet

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @m_maria_a you will most likely need to read the academic papers that describe the algorithms

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @m_maria_a every value is extremely important and changing one value could make everything break

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @m_maria_a maybe this intro article will help: https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/0177/00ba0459185e3670d3317d54f137c4fef8b6.pdf

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: which compares MD5 and SHA1

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: SHA1 was made to replace MD5. MD5 replaced MD4,3,2,1,0......

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: SHA2 and SHA3 replace SHA1

Author: m_maria_a#0348
Content: i found some academic papers however they do not really explain the source of choosing those algorithms, thank you very much for the link

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the algorithms are chosen such that they are very hard to attack

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the numbers/constants are discovered via experimentation, optimized to make attacks the least efficient

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: very few people in the world can come up with new secure cryptographic hash functions

Author: m_maria_a#0348
Content: i know the general idea and the hierarchy of the algorithms as well as some more advanced mathematical tools used in them however the understanding of them do not really help me in understanding why thy not any other where chosen. However, as i am very new to the topic most of it is still dark matter for me

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @m_maria_a it's trivial to "backdoor" an algorithm by changing a few constants, governments do this

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @m_maria_a are you asking why a certain constant was chosen in 1 algorithm, or why certain algorithms are chosen over others?

Author: m_maria_a#0348
Content: why a certain constant was chosen in an algorithm

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: This is the best known proven government backdoor in a crypto library: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dual_EC_DRBG

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @m_maria_a it was chosen to maximize attack cost, is the most general answer

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @m_maria_a which level of math background do you have, may I ask?

Author: m_maria_a#0348
Content: but is there any explanation available why it was the best option in decreasing  the potential attack of the hackers?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Differential_cryptanalysis

Author: m_maria_a#0348
Content: i take mathematics hl in ib diploma programme

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @m_maria_a have you done calculus yet?

Author: m_maria_a#0348
Content: yes

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: math classes that people take are very different in different countries

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @m_maria_a read about Differential cryptanalysis above, you will understand some if you have calculus knowledge. Might need to learn a bit more about differentials but you are well on the way

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: all new algorithms are put thru attack scenarios, and optimized

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: just like blockchains, at least the good ones
